{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3327453,"name":"","username":"Slynyr","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/58f4c7/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-08T01:52:30.273Z","cooked":"

Hello ,

Up until recently we have been testing photon vision with level cameras and have since mounted them at an angle. Ever since we angled them, we have been unable to get accurate positioning data. The rotation is accurate however, it seems to be constantly off laterally by about 1 meter.

The following images are examples of our pose estimation in front of both the amp and trap. The yellow box indicates what the actual robot position is:

IncorrectTags638×754 558 KB

Initially we thought the issue was a result of the camera transformations being incorrect however, I am pretty confident that they are correct as shown below:

(Camera mounted 0.41m forward, 0.22m above the ground, and angled 30 degrees upwards)

        public static final Transform3d FRONT_CAMERA_OFFSET = new Transform3d(
                new Translation3d(0.418846, 0, 0.2234184),
                new Rotation3d(0, Math.toRadians(-30), 0));

Has anyone here experienced similar issues or have some advice?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-08T01:52:30.273Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":361,"reads":354,"readers_count":353,"score":1890.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":457818,"topic_slug":"photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/0/b/0b646674efb4324c41bd54da2c8c36ceaa2f21a2.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/photon-vision-estimating-pose-incorrectly/461535","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Photon Vision Estimating Pose Incorrectly","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64893,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras/457818/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3327495,"name":"4907 mentor & enthusiast","username":"ca2devri","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ca2devri/{size}/189324_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-08T02:35:09.468Z","cooked":"

Sorry if this is too dumb but could you have your x and y offsets mixed up? According to your numbers you camera is 44 cm back but in the center of your robot laterally?

I think it can be quite sensitive to the pitch angle and I calibrated it by lining up to a tag but I’m not sure that would cause what you are seeing.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-08T02:35:09.468Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":332,"readers_count":331,"score":111.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":457818,"topic_slug":"photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras","display_username":"4907 mentor & enthusiast","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55295,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4907 Mentor / Enthusiast"},"post_url":"/t/photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras/457818/2","custom_user_title":"4907 Mentor / Enthusiast","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3328587,"name":"","username":"Slynyr","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/58f4c7/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-09T18:21:27.755Z","cooked":"

As far as I’m aware, according to the PhotonVision documentation, PhotonVision uses the WPILIB coordinate system. Given my transformations, that would imply that the camera is mounted 44cm forward and centred laterally. Regardless, I have attempted to flip the axis as you suggested and it still didn’t help.

Could you elaborate on what you meant by “calibrated it by lining up to a tag”? For calibration we have validated the angles both in cad and real world, and completed chessboard calibration.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-09T19:18:31.635Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":304,"readers_count":303,"score":70.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":457818,"topic_slug":"photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":3,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.photonvision.org/en/latest/docs/apriltag-pipelines/coordinate-systems.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Coordinate Systems - PhotonVision Docs","clicks":15}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":55295,"username":"ca2devri","name":"4907 mentor & enthusiast","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ca2devri/{size}/189324_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64893,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras/457818/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3328682,"name":"4907 mentor & enthusiast","username":"ca2devri","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ca2devri/{size}/189324_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-09T21:51:49.836Z","cooked":"

I lined the robot up to a known position right in front of a tag (which I had previously verified was at the right position and height). Then I adjusted my camera pitch and yaw in the code until I got the right answer. The results can be pretty sensitive to the camera angles (for example maybe you think you have the camera at 15 degrees, but if you have it at 17 degrees it could cause a lot of error in some instances).

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-09T21:51:49.836Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":285,"readers_count":284,"score":82.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":457818,"topic_slug":"photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras","display_username":"4907 mentor & enthusiast","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55295,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4907 Mentor / Enthusiast"},"post_url":"/t/photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras/457818/4","custom_user_title":"4907 Mentor / Enthusiast","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3332528,"name":"Sam M","username":"Sammm","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/e8c25b/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-13T23:59:32.559Z","cooked":"

Shouldn’t the camera to target automatically take into account the pitch and yaw of the target? I’m having issues with the camera to target result.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-13T23:59:32.559Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":239,"readers_count":238,"score":52.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":457818,"topic_slug":"photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras","display_username":"Sam M","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":55295,"username":"ca2devri","name":"4907 mentor & enthusiast","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ca2devri/{size}/189324_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55615,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras/457818/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3332543,"name":"4907 mentor & enthusiast","username":"ca2devri","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ca2devri/{size}/189324_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-14T00:27:43.665Z","cooked":"

You definitely need to tell it the angles of your camera. It has no way of knowing that.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-14T00:27:43.665Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":223,"readers_count":222,"score":54.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":457818,"topic_slug":"photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras","display_username":"4907 mentor & enthusiast","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":55615,"username":"Sammm","name":"Sam M","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/e8c25b/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55295,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4907 Mentor / Enthusiast"},"post_url":"/t/photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras/457818/6","custom_user_title":"4907 Mentor / Enthusiast","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3332548,"name":"Sam M","username":"Sammm","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/e8c25b/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-14T00:35:28.227Z","cooked":"

Does the dashboard X and Y values assume that the camera is perpendicular to the ground?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-14T00:35:28.227Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":215,"readers_count":214,"score":53.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":457818,"topic_slug":"photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras","display_username":"Sam M","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":55295,"username":"ca2devri","name":"4907 mentor & enthusiast","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ca2devri/{size}/189324_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55615,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras/457818/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3332608,"name":"Dan Langdon","username":"woodworker2001","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/bbe5ce/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-14T01:58:02.441Z","cooked":"

Your camera to robot for the pose estimator needs to give the x,y,z roll, pitch, yaw of the camera relative to the robot center. This is imperative to getting an accurate robot pose

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-14T01:58:02.441Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":206,"readers_count":205,"score":46.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":457818,"topic_slug":"photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras","display_username":"Dan Langdon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":55615,"username":"Sammm","name":"Sam M","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/e8c25b/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51496,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras/457818/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3332610,"name":"Sam M","username":"Sammm","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/e8c25b/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-14T02:01:49.256Z","cooked":"

Yeah I get that, my issue is that the X distance to my camera (viewed on the dashboard) is greater than the ground truth when the camera is viewing the target from below with an angle upward of around 15°. When I move the camera perpendicular to the ground, it is accurate. Would that issue be solved using the pose estimator?

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-14T02:05:51.012Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":194,"readers_count":193,"score":58.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":457818,"topic_slug":"photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras","display_username":"Sam M","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":51496,"username":"woodworker2001","name":"Dan Langdon","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/bbe5ce/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55615,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras/457818/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3332624,"name":"Dan Langdon","username":"woodworker2001","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/bbe5ce/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-14T02:09:14.765Z","cooked":"

You should be using a photon pose estimator. That takes into account the position of the camera and translates the returned pose to a robot center pose ( at least as I understand what you are doing)

PhotonVision Documentation

Using WPILib Pose Estimation, Simulation, and PhotonVision Together

The following example comes from the PhotonLib example repository ( Java). Full code is available at that links. Knowledge and Equipment Needed: Everything required in Combining Aiming and Getting ...

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-14T02:10:45.285Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":194,"readers_count":193,"score":53.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":457818,"topic_slug":"photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras","display_username":"Dan Langdon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.photonvision.org/en/latest/docs/examples/simposeest.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Using WPILib Pose Estimation, Simulation, and PhotonVision Together - PhotonVision Docs","clicks":30}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":55615,"username":"Sammm","name":"Sam M","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/e8c25b/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51496,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/photonvision-pose-estimator-no-longer-accurate-after-angling-cameras/457818/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3332642,"name":"","username":"Slynyr","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/58f4c7/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-14T02:36:38.673Z","cooked":"

The issue I was having turned out to be due to the smart dashboard sometimes displaying the robot pose incorrectly. I was able to validate this by using a limelight which has its own 3D visualisation of the field and its pose estimation. I realized that although the limelight map showed the correct position, and my pose estimator coordinates matched that of the limelight, smart dashboard was still showing the incorrect position as shown in the image above. At the moment, I am still not sure why that is.

If you would like to validate your pose estimation readings, line up your robot against the BLUE AMP. You should be sitting around x: 1.82, y: 7.73
(Y value may vary based on robot dimensions)

As for camera rotations, you should follow the WPILIB coordinate system as shown below:

public static final Transform3d CAMERA_OFFSET = new Transform3d(
        new Translation3d(0.418846, 0, 0.2234184), //0.41m forward, 0m left, and 0.22m up
        new Rotation3d(Math.toRadians(90), Math.toRadians(-30), Math.toRadians(180))); 
        //Camera rolled 90 degrees, pitched upwards 30 degrees, and yawed 180 degrees (facing the back of the robot)

Another thing to note is that there is currently a bug that causes issues if you do the 3D calibration when the camera orientation on the web client is not set to normal. If your camera is upside down or on its side, just leave the orientation as normal, do the calibration, and then apply any transformations needed as shown in the code snippet above.

It was broken at the start of the season, but should be fixed now:

github.com/wpilibsuite/allwpilib

[Glass/simgui] 2024 field image is not positioned correctly for coordinate system

opened 11:16PM - 08 Jan 24 UTC
closed 06:54AM - 14 Jan 24 UTC
shueja

**Describe the bug** ![image](https://github.com/wpilibsuite/allwpilib/assets/3…2416547/a9f75c29-fbbc-4528-92ef-f9fe70fb846d) Also, the field dimensions show as 2023's dimensions when 2024 is selected **To Reproduce** - Open a field visualization in Glass or SimGui (this probably requires making a robot project with a Field2d published) - Set the image to 2024.

According to the PhotonVision devs, it seems to only be an issue during calibration however, just to be safe I chose to not apply any transformations through the web client. If you plan on also using your April tag cameras as driver cams, then you maybe you can set a transformation through the web client otherwise I would just avoid doing so as a precaution.
